title.narrative: OUTPUT 2.4. EMERGENCY RESPONSE NUTRITION

description.narrative: By end 2021 in targeted zones the DNTA, the divisions of the Ministry of Public Health and NGOs have the capacity to implement nutrition emergency preparedness and response for women, adolescents and children under five years, which contributes to Early Detection And Treatment Of Malnutrition, Early Detection And Treatment Of Malnutrition (Covid), Infant And Young Child Feeding, Nutrition And Emergencies, Nutrition In Early Childhood, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Nutrition â€“ General. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 2. By the end of 2022, adolescents, pregnant and breastfeeding women, mothers and children aged 0-5 years make greater use of quality nutritional services and adopt adequate nutrition and feeding practices in 15 provinces.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By end 2021 in targeted zones the DNTA, the divisions of the Ministry of Public Health and NGOs have the capacity to implementnutrition emergency preparedness and response for women, adolescents and children under five years

description.narrative: The capacity of the Department of Nutrition and Food Technology and its decentralized services was reinforced for better preparedness and response to nutritional emergencies and assistance to refugees. Joint monitoring and analysis were conducted to inform the implementation of the programme. In the emergency provinces, 249,513 children suffering from SAM were admitted for treatment. The implementation of adaptive measures for the management of acute malnutrition in the context of the COVID-19 pandemic was evaluated, and findings are being used to revise the national guidance. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:22/01/2022
